ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: on the right and on the left in scattered groups!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: in crowds, both on the right and on the left?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: left and right, in numerous groups?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: From the right and the left, in groups?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: On the right and on the left, `Izin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: On the right hand and on the left, in sundry parties?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: towards thee on the right hand and on the left hand in knots?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: On the right and on the left, in groups?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: from the right and from the left, in crowds?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: On the right and on the left, in companies?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: from left and right, in groups?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: From the right and from the left, in crowds?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (Sitting) in groups on the right and on the left (of you, O Muhammad SAW)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: on the right and on the left in groups?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: From the right, and from the left, banding together?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:37] to the right and to the left, of you, in droves? (‘izīna is also a circumstantial qualifier), in other words, in groups standing in circles, one next to the other, saying, in mockery of the believers, ‘Verily if [the likes of] these are to enter Paradise, we shall enter it before them’. God, exalted be He, says:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Dispersed (On the right and on the left, in groups?
